revised_title: Further Researches on the Absorption and Radiation of Heat by Gaseous and Liquid Matter
tldr: The author presents a new apparatus to study the transmission of radiant heat through different thicknesses of the same gaseous body. The experiments reveal that certain gases, such as carbonic oxide, carbonic acid, nitrous oxide, and olefiant gas, have varying absorption rates of heat, with some being more opaque to radiant heat than others.
